main.name: David Gao
main.bio: My hobbies include playing video games, tinkering with hardware, playing music and staying fit. I'm not a shy guy and I enjoy tough challenges. I want to get to know as many people in my lifetime as I can, and I bet I can find something to talk about that will be interesting to the both of us. Feel free to reach out to me by email or on through Linkedin.

education.description: Specialist (Co-operative) Program in Computer Science - Software Engineering Stream

work.title: Full Stack Engineer
work.description:
• Constructed a React webpage, from scratch, to display hundreds of rows of invoice data, in a report format, for an multi-million-dollar onboarding agreement
• Composed Node.js jobs for a variety of tasks including ingesting files from external SFTP servers, aggregating and manipulating data in MongoDB, and producing user friendly reports for clients
• Set up Kafka producers and consumers to link together Node.js jobs as well as produce and consume telemetry for existing applications
• Created Terraform plans to automate Kubernetes pod generation when cron jobs should be scheduled
• Refactored legacy React components to be generic and AODA compliant for improved reusability, scalability and performance optimization

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description:
• With the help of the director, we introduced the teams to the new Operational Excellence role so that developers are conscious of monitoring and alerting while building features
• Migrated the existing telemetry pipeline to utilize the TICK (Telegraf, InfluxDB, Chronograf and Kapacitor) stack for greater reliability and accurate alerting
• Built and managed Golang services to support large loads of requests such as looking up millions of identity information, looking up millions of profiles, decryption millions of IDs and looking up profiles through cache, all in milliseconds
• Refactored enormous end-to-end test suites to modular unit tests so that test development would be more concise and tests can be run more frequently
• Maintained Gitlab CI/CD pipelines to allow for automated testing and seamless deployments

work.title: Test Automation Engineer
work.description:
• Developed, maintained and executed automation programs for front end web applications written in Angular
• Tests were developed in Protractor particularly used to automate testing functionality in desktop and mobile websites
• The program executed stability tests and often reported significant bugs when modifications are made to the web application
• Optimized the developers’ tasks by reviewing PHP scripts that are reported as malfunctioning and suggest corrections
• Awarded permissions to correct defective PHP scripts myself to be reviewed by the developers
• Consequently given opportunities, from time to time, to help developers resolve bugs on their main applications in Java as well
• Develop a dashboard in AngularJS, HTML and CSS to display the current status of the engineering team for the entire company to view, on company monitors, by incorporating Jira API

projects.title: IXAccomplishments
projects.category: Employee kudos web application for enterprise use

projects.title: Morning Dashboard
projects.category: Displays daily weather, tweets, jira updates as a slideshow for company monitors

projects.title: Personal Website
projects.category: A website written in React to display my up-to-date employment status and allow others to download my resume

projects.title: Robot Soccer
projects.category: Program written in NXC to allow a lego robot to compete with others in fast-pace soccer matches

testimonials.text: David joined Index Exchange for his last co-op term before graduating, and very quickly became a contributing member of his team. On-boarding was easy, and within weeks David was fully productive. He showed enthusiasm and drive from day one, and his team knew they can count on him for anything from writing and testing code, to facilitating team meetings and representing the team in front the entire division. He is responsible, dependable and hard working, and met or exceeded all expectations we had set for him.
